alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 11:32PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CADDO AND WEST CENTRAL BOSSIER PARISHES...SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND EAST CENTRAL HARRISON COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1131 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Karnack, or 16 miles northeast of Marshall, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Oil City, Mooringsport, Scottsville, Uncertain, Caddo Lake, Spring Ridge, Cross Lake, Leigh, Jonesville, and Bethany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
